channel.title: CVE Feed for Nvidia Corporation -- GPU Display Driver
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Nvidia Corporation -- GPU Display Driver

item.title: CVE-2017-6294|2024-09-16T17:15:30.614Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: In Android before the 2018-06-05 security patch level, NVIDIA Tegra X1 TZ contains a possible out of bounds write due to missing bounds check which could lead to escalation of privilege from the kernel to the TZ. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. This issue is rated as high. Version: N/A. Android: A-69316825. Reference: N-CVE-2017-6294.

item.title: CVE-2017-6292|2024-09-16T17:59:19.251Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: In Android before the 2018-06-05 security patch level, NVIDIA TLZ TrustZone contains a possible out of bounds write due to integer overflow which could lead to local escalation of privilege in the TrustZone with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. This issue is rated as high. Version: N/A. Android: A-69480285. Reference: N-CVE-2017-6292.

item.title: CVE-2018-6252|2024-09-16T17:24:03.220Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler for DxgkDdiEscape where the software allows an actor access to restricted functionality that is unnecessary to production usage, and which may result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2017-6267|2024-09-16T16:22:46.175Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where an incorrect initialization of internal objects can cause an infinite loop which may lead to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2017-6268|2024-09-16T18:08:05.764Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a value passed from a user to the driver is not correctly validated and used as the index to an array which may lead to denial of service or possible escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-6277|2024-09-16T19:30:51.429Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a value passed from a user to the driver is not correctly validated and used as the index to an array which may lead to denial of service or possible escalation of privileges.
